title: Problem 2090_C
statement: Inside the large kingdom, there is an infinite dining hall. It can be represented as a set of cells (x, y), where x and y are non-negative integers. There are an infinite number of tables in the hall. Each table occupies four cells (3x + 1, 3y + 1), (3x + 1, 3y + 2), (3x + 2, 3y + 1), (3x + 2, 3y + 2), where x and y are arbitrary non-negative integers. All cells that do not belong to any of the tables are corridors.There are n guests that come to the dining hall one by one. Each guest appears in
